young.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a young person, plant, or animal has not lived for very long
young.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: You’re too young to get married.
When I was young, I wanted to be a model.
John was a great footballer in his younger days (=when he was younger).
young.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a young country, organization, or type of science has existed for only a short time
young.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: At that time, America was still a young nation.
young.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: seeming or looking younger than you are
young.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Val is incredibly young for her age.
young.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: designed or intended for young people
young.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: I’m looking for something in a younger style.
young.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2: We met a young German couple
We met a German young couple
young.translation[0].note_box[1].section: young
not old
a young man of about 22
My dad died when I was young.
There are excellent facilities for young children.
Young people are often unable to get jobs.
small/little
a small child is very young. Little sounds more informal than small, and is used especially in spoken English
They have two small children.
We used to go camping a lot when the kids were little.
teenage
between the ages of 13 and 19
a group of teenage boys
They have three teenage children.
adolescent
at the age when you change from being a child into an adult – used especially when talking about the problems that young people have at this age
Sudden mood changes are common in adolescent girls.
adolescent behaviour
juvenile
connected with young people who commit crime
juvenile crime
a special prison for juvenile offenders
juvenile delinquents (=young people who commit crimes)
youthful
seeming young, or typical of someone who is young – often used about someone who is no longer young
a youthful 55-year-old
youthful enthusiasm
Andrew still has a slim youthful look about him.
The photograph showed a youthful, smiling Rose.
junior
connected with sports played by young people rather than adults
the junior championships
the junior champion
when you are young
childhood
the time when you are a child, especially a young child
I had a wonderful childhood in the country.
childhood illnesses
girlhood/boyhood
the time when you are a young girl or boy
The two men had been friends in boyhood.
the transition from girlhood to womanhood
youth
the time when you are young, especially between about 15 and 25 when you are no longer a child
He was a great sportsman in his youth.
She revisited all the places where she had spent her youth.
adolescence
the time when you are changing from being a child into an adult – used especially when you are talking about the problems people have at this age
During adolescence, boys are often lacking in self-confidence.
infancy
the time when you are a baby
In the past, many more babies died in infancy.
young.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a group of young animals that belong to a particular mother or type of animal
young.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The lioness fought to protect her young.
